User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110127 Firefox/4.0b11pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110127 Firefox/4.0b11pre

I tried to put the location and search boxes on the same toolbar than tabs, to maximize the page size (Firefox beta 4 allows this).

It works quite well but when I open too many tabs, the location box becomes too small and therefore unusable. So does the search box.

I think a way of putting a width limit for the tabs area should be possible in order to allow the cohabitation of the location and the search box with tabs on the same toolbar, which might be a nice feature.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. right-click on a toolbar, "Customize"
2. put the location / search boxes on the tabs toolbar
3. open many tabs (e.g. by doing ctrl+t)
Actual Results:  
The location / search boxes become to small.

Expected Results:  
They should remain usable even with many tabs opened; setting the maximum width of the tabs area should be possible.
comments.creator: dysinscr@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Since IE9 will place tabs and location bar in the same toolbar, people may try this in Firefox as well. It would be nice if this would be functional, since that shows the power of Firefox; you can adjust it the way you like it. It would also allow Firefox to win in these height comparisons: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ie/archive/2011/02/15/user-experiences-listen-learn-refine.aspx

I think the preferred way to make this work is by adding resizers between tabs and location/search bar when they adjoin, just like it is done now for the location - search bar combination. If this bug were fixed, it would allow people to browse with an incredibly tiny, yet fully usable browser.
comments.creator: pino_sb@live.com
